name: Sukapi Lodge
description: This is the first licensed and certified Native American-owned and tribally-run mental health center in Montana, blending Western therapeutic methods with Blackfeet traditional values

name: Butte Native Wellness Center
description: An outpatient clinic serving the American Indian and Alaska Native communities of Butte, Montana, and surrounding areas, offering mental health, substance abuse recovery, and primary healthcare services with a focus on culturally relevant treatment

name: Helena Indian Alliance
description: A Federally Qualified Health Center providing primary care and mental health services to the Helena community, with a mission to advocate for and serve the mental, physical, spiritual, and social wellness of the American Indian/Alaska Native population

name: All Nations Health Center
description: Provides culturally grounded, holistic healthcare to Native American and broader Missoula communities, including behavioral health services

name: CSKT Tribal Health (Behavioral Health Services)
address: Locations in Elmo, Polson, Ronan, and St. Ignatius, Montana
description: Offers a range of behavioral health services, including mental health evaluation, psychotherapy, addiction treatment, and psychological assessments, available in-person or via telehealth

name: Healing Mountain Mental Health
description: A practice offering evidence-based therapy and aiming to bring awareness and social change to the mental health community, serving as a safe space for various groups, including those who experience systemic oppression. Barb Debree, LCSW, the owner, has experience working with individuals on Native American reservations in Montana

name: Sacred Pathways
description: An all-inclusive mental health practice offering a safe and compassionate space for individuals to explore their thoughts and feelings

name: Rebecca Fallon (Licensed Addictions Counselor and Licensed Clinical Professional Counselor)
description: Specializes in supporting adult clients struggling with addiction and has 9 years of experience as a Native American License Addiction Counselor

name: Dan Foster (Licensed Professional Counselor Candidate and Licensed Addiction Counselor)
description: Focuses on supporting healing and personal growth, welcoming individuals from all walks of life, including those seeking support for addiction recovery

name: Suzanne A Trusler (Enrolled member of the Northern Cheyenne tribe)
description: Holds a master's degree in both Community Health and Mental Health Counseling and offers in-office and online counseling with a holistic approach
